data.name: ASCII characters are displaced. Can you get the original string? Easy version.
data.description:
Can you get the original string?

We can translate text into ASCII table codes, for example "hello world": ```javascript 104 101 108 108 111 32 119 111 114 108 100 ``` It would be too easy. Not. You get an array of ASCII codes. BUT. 1. The numbers are shifted by some number N. 2. For simplicity, there will be only one letter, which occurs more often than others. The input is an array of ASCII codes and the most common character. For 'hello world' might look like this(shift - 30): ```javascript function translator([134, 131, 138, 138, 141, 32, 149, 141, 144, 138, 130], 'l') {...} ```

Task:

You need return original string: ```javascript return "hello world" ``` To simplify the work, there will be no characters in the text except: a-z and a space (the space code is not shifted!)
It's all, that you need know, to solve this kata.
P.S. "space" ASCII symbol have code - 32.
